dublin_core.dcvalue: Electronic medical records allow the quick and easy incorporation of data into the medical records By virtue of their design questionnaire responses can be entered and used in the electronic environment with little or no effort on the part of the practicing physician Data can be captured through various means stored and then viewed when the patient visits the office Data can also be shared for use by other physicians in the practice or in large databases Easy access and availability should allow for greater use of questionnaires by physicians resulting in better patient care
Best practice And research. Clinical rheumatology
Integrating patient questionnaire data into electronic medical records.
